properties.name: location
properties.description: Set to yes or no to turn the InAppBrowser's location bar on or off.

properties.name: hidden
properties.description: Set to yes to create the browser and load the page, but not show it. The loadstop event fires when loading is complete.Omit or set to no (default) to have the browser open and load normally.

properties.name: clearcache
properties.description: Set to yes to have the browser's cookie cache cleared before the new window is opened.

properties.name: clearsessioncache
properties.description: Set to yes to have the session cookie cache cleared before the new window is opened.

properties.name: zoom
properties.description: (Android Only) set to yes to show Android browser's zoom controls, set to no to hide them. Default value is yes.

properties.name: hardwareback
properties.description: Set to yes to use the hardware back button to navigate backwards through the InAppBrowser's history.If there is no previous page, the InAppBrowser will close. The default value is yes, so you must set it to no if you want the back button to simply close the InAppBrowser.

properties.name: mediaPlaybackRequiresUserAction
properties.description: Set to yes to prevent HTML5 audio or video from autoplaying (defaults to no).

properties.name: shouldPauseOnSuspend
properties.description: (Android Only) Set to yes to make InAppBrowser WebView to pause/resume with the app to stop background audio (this may be required to avoid Google Play issues)

properties.name: closebuttoncaption
properties.description: (iOS Only) Set to a string to use as the Done button's caption. Note that you need to localize this value yourself.

properties.name: disallowoverscroll
properties.description: (iOS Only) Set to yes or no (default is no). Turns on/off the UIWebViewBounce property.

properties.name: toolbar
properties.description: (iOS Only) Set to yes or no to turn the toolbar on or off for the InAppBrowser (defaults to yes)

properties.name: enableViewportScale
properties.description: (iOS Only)  Set to yes or no to prevent viewport scaling through a meta tag (defaults to no).

properties.name: allowInlineMediaPlayback
properties.description: (iOS Only) Set to yes or no to allow in-line HTML5 media playback, displaying within the browser window rather than a device-specific playback interface.The HTML's video element must also include the webkit-playsinline attribute (defaults to no)

properties.name: keyboardDisplayRequiresUserAction
properties.description: (iOS Only) Set to yes or no to open the keyboard when form elements receive focus via JavaScript's focus() call (defaults to yes).

properties.name: suppressesIncrementalRendering
properties.description: (iOS Only) Set to yes or no to wait until all new view content is received before being rendered (defaults to no).

properties.name: presentationstyle
properties.description: (iOS Only) Set to pagesheet, formsheet or fullscreen to set the presentation style (defaults to fullscreen).

properties.name: transitionstyle
properties.description: (iOS Only) Set to fliphorizontal, crossdissolve or coververtical to set the transition style (defaults to coververtical).

properties.name: toolbarposition
properties.description: (iOS Only) Set to top or bottom (default is bottom). Causes the toolbar to be at the top or bottom of the window.

properties.name: fullscreen
properties.description: (Windows only) Set to yes to create the browser control without a border around it.Please note that if location=no is also specified, there will be no control presented to user to close IAB window.
